coverage: Comprehensive Amos: prophet & Tekoa setting; Uzziah/Jeroboam frame; earthquake marker; full nation oracles (Damascus, Gaza, Tyre, Edom, Ammon, Moab, Judah, Israel); social classes & court critiques; shrines (Bethel/Gilgal/Beersheba) and Amaziah confrontation; geographies and comparison cities; five visions + intercessions; theological hymns, Day of YHWH, justice ethic, famine of the word; granular indictments; counter‑liturgies; restoration (Booth of David) and Acts 15 reception.
id_scheme: Cross-book stable by (type+primary-slug) with alias support; deterministic for new entries; reuses shared entities where present.

entries.name: Amos of Tekoa
entries.blurb: Sheepbreeder and dresser of sycamore figs from Tekoa. A layman summoned by YHWH to confront northern Israel’s injustice and cultic corruption.

entries.name: Tekoa (Judah)
entries.blurb: Village south of Jerusalem—launch pad for a prophetic mission that crosses borders into Israel.

entries.name: Earthquake marker (two years before)
entries.blurb: Seismic memory dating Amos’ ministry—a shaking that embodies the book’s theme of divine disturbance.

entries.name: Call narrative: ‘I was no prophet… but the LORD took me’
entries.blurb: Amos resists professional labels; vocation is an interruption—authority grounded in divine initiative, not guild status.

entries.name: Uzziah of Judah
entries.blurb: Prosperous monarch; his reign provides the southern datum for Amos’ date.

entries.name: Jeroboam II of Israel
entries.blurb: Northern ruler during Israel’s economic boom. Amos predicts the sword against his house.

entries.name: House of Jeroboam
entries.blurb: Dynastic target of plumb‑line judgment; prosperity without justice proves terminal.

entries.name: Damascus (Aram)
entries.blurb: Threshing Gilead with iron sledges—industrialized cruelty; Damascus’ gates and bars will break.

entries.name: Gaza (Philistia)
entries.blurb: Mass deportations and slave trafficking; the remnant of Philistines perishes.

entries.name: Tyre (Phoenicia)
entries.blurb: Betrayed a treaty of brotherhood and trafficked captives; walls devoured by fire.

entries.name: Edom
entries.blurb: Perpetual anger and unrelenting wrath against his brother; Teman/Bozrah consumed.

entries.name: Ammon
entries.blurb: Ripped open pregnant women to enlarge borders; Milcom goes into exile.

entries.name: Moab
entries.blurb: Burned the bones of Edom’s king—war crime against the dead; judge and princes cut off.

entries.name: Judah
entries.blurb: Rejected the law of YHWH; lies led them astray; Jerusalem consumed by fire.

entries.name: Israel
entries.blurb: Oppresses the poor, corrupts Nazirites, silences prophets; swift, strong, and mighty will not escape.

entries.name: Cows of Bashan (wealthy women)
entries.blurb: Affluent women who crush the needy and demand drink; luxury morphs into predation.

entries.name: Merchants with false balances
entries.blurb: Eager for the new moon to end so they can cheat with ephah and shekel; selling chaff as grain.

entries.name: Judges at the gate (corrupted)
entries.blurb: They hate the truth‑teller, take bribes, and push aside the needy in the gate—justice perverted.

entries.name: Drunkards of Samaria
entries.blurb: At ease in Zion and Samaria; anointed with oils, invent songs, but are not grieved over Joseph’s ruin.

entries.name: Nazirites given wine
entries.blurb: Consecrated ascetics are pressured to violate vows—holiness mocked.

entries.name: Prophets silenced (‘Do not prophesy!’)
entries.blurb: Spiritual gag order at royal sanctuary—truth evicted from liturgical space.

entries.name: Righteous sold for silver and sandals
entries.blurb: Human life priced at pocket change; sexual exploitation compounds economic injustice.

entries.name: Oppressed needy at the gate
entries.blurb: Those who seek justice are crushed—Amos calls for goodness in the courts.

entries.name: Bethel (royal sanctuary)
entries.blurb: Calf‑cult hub and king’s chapel; Amos’ words dismantle its pretensions.

entries.name: Gilgal (pilgrimage center)
entries.blurb: Religious busyness without obedience; going to Gilgal multiplies transgression.

entries.name: Beersheba (southern shrine)
entries.blurb: Pilgrimage to the south offers no refuge; only seeking YHWH gives life.

entries.name: Amaziah the priest of Bethel
entries.blurb: Institutional gatekeeper who expels Amos; receives a hard oracle against his house.

entries.name: Amaziah’s wife (becomes a prostitute)
entries.blurb: Personal fallout of resisting God’s word—prophetic judgment reaches the household.

entries.name: Amaziah’s children (fall by the sword)
entries.blurb: The next generation suffers consequence—dynastic pretension ends.

entries.name: Jeroboam II (in the Bethel dispute)
entries.blurb: Named by Amaziah in the accusation; the ‘house of Jeroboam’ faces the plumb line.

entries.name: Samaria (capital)
entries.blurb: Seat of luxury and injustice; foreign observers summoned to witness her turmoil.

entries.name: Mount Zion (in tension with Samaria)
entries.blurb: Security in Zion is also rebuked—religious privilege cannot shield injustice.

entries.name: Calneh
entries.blurb: Example city for comparative downfall—go and see: are you better?

entries.name: Hamath the great
entries.blurb: Northern power used illustratively—its greatness could not save it.

entries.name: Gath of the Philistines
entries.blurb: Philistine city invoked for rhetorical comparison—learn from history.

entries.name: Mount Carmel
entries.blurb: No hiding place: even Carmel’s caves cannot conceal from divine pursuit.

entries.name: The Arabah (rift valley)
entries.blurb: Rhetorical terrain for impossibilities—horses running on rocks? plowing the sea?

entries.name: Egypt (exodus memory)
entries.blurb: God who brought Israel from Egypt judges them by the same covenant grace.

entries.name: Philistia & Aram (migration sovereignty)
entries.blurb: God moved Philistines from Caphtor and Arameans from Kir—history is under His providence.

entries.name: Vision: Locust swarm
entries.blurb: Post‑king’s mowing locusts threaten subsistence farms; Amos intercedes, and YHWH relents.

entries.name: Vision: Fire consuming the deep
entries.blurb: Cosmic drought/fire; again Amos intercedes, again YHWH relents—mercy delays judgment.

entries.name: Vision: Plumb line
entries.blurb: God measures Israel’s house; high places and sanctuaries face demolition; house of Jeroboam cut off.

entries.name: Vision: Basket of summer fruit
entries.blurb: Wordplay (qayitz/ketz) signals ‘the end’; songs of the temple become wails.

entries.name: Vision: YHWH beside the altar
entries.blurb: Final, unrelenting judgment: no escape to Sheol, heavens, Carmel, or sea.

entries.name: Amos’ intercessions (twice)
entries.blurb: ‘O Lord GOD, please forgive/cease!’—prophetic ministry includes pleading for mercy.

entries.name: YHWH relents… then will not relent
entries.blurb: Pedagogy of patience gives way to decisive judgment when hardness persists.

entries.name: You only have I known (election & accountability)
entries.blurb: Privilege intensifies responsibility—chosen people are held to covenant ethics.

entries.name: Does a lion roar…? (rhetorical chain)
entries.blurb: Logic of cause and effect culminates: the lion roars—who will not fear? the Lord speaks—who can but prophesy?

entries.name: Seek me and live
entries.blurb: Pilgrimage will not save; seeking YHWH’s face reorients life toward justice.

entries.name: Day of YHWH is darkness, not light
entries.blurb: Religious triumphalism shattered—the Day exposes and reverses false hopes.

entries.name: Hymn: Maker of Pleiades and Orion
entries.blurb: Doctrinal spine for ethics: the Creator who turns dawn to darkness charges the mighty.

entries.name: Hymn: He who forms the mountains…
entries.blurb: Doxology interrupts satire—majestic Creator strides on the heights of the earth.

entries.name: Hymn: The LORD of hosts… who builds his chambers
entries.blurb: Cosmic architecture hymn frames the final oracle—sovereign over sea and land.

entries.name: Let justice roll down like waters
entries.blurb: Iconic line calling for structural righteousness, not liturgical noise.

entries.name: Famine of hearing the words of the LORD
entries.blurb: Judgment by silence—spiritual drought worse than crop failure.

entries.name: Irony & sarcasm: ‘Go to Bethel and sin’
entries.blurb: Prophetic mockery exposes performative piety—religion as vice.

entries.name: Dirge over Israel (qinah)
entries.blurb: Funeral song anticipates national death—lament as truth‑telling.

entries.name: Woe oracles
entries.blurb: ‘Woe to you who desire the day of the LORD… Woe to the complacent in Zion…’—prophetic grief in judgment.

entries.name: Swearing, lying, murder, stealing, adultery (ten‑commandment breach)
entries.blurb: Decalogue violations as social fabric tears—Torah ethics are public goods.

entries.name: Panting after the dust on the head of the poor
entries.blurb: Even trivial pledges seized; humiliation monetized.

entries.name: Father and son go in to the same girl
entries.blurb: Sexual exploitation sanctified by cult payments—defiles God’s holy name.

entries.name: Garments taken in pledge beside every altar
entries.blurb: Illegal collateral kept overnight; sanctuaries become comfort lounges for oppressors.

entries.name: Wine bought with fines in the house of their god
entries.blurb: Miscarriage of justice funds revelry—legal system as bar tab.

entries.name: Ivory houses & winter/summer homes
entries.blurb: Luxury real estate faces demolition; God’s sledgehammer against ostentation.

entries.name: Stretching themselves on beds of ivory
entries.blurb: Self‑indulgence indicts leaders who ignore collapse.

entries.name: Inventing instruments like David (satirized)
entries.blurb: Music without mercy—art co‑opted by decadence.

entries.name: Not grieved over the ruin of Joseph
entries.blurb: Core failure: numbness to covenant neighbor.

entries.name: Turning justice to wormwood
entries.blurb: Sweet law made bitter; righteousness cast to the ground.

entries.name: Hating the one who rebukes in the gate
entries.blurb: Anti‑prophetic animus; truth‑tellers become enemy number one.

entries.name: Bribes and perverted justice
entries.blurb: Economic clout hijacks courts; righteousness priced out.

entries.name: Seek good, not evil, that you may live
entries.blurb: Moral reorientation paired with civic reform: establish justice in the gate; maybe God will be gracious.

entries.name: Hate evil, love good
entries.blurb: Affective discipleship underwrites structural change—love must be legislated in practice.

entries.name: Let justice be established in the gate
entries.blurb: Judicial reform as repentance enacted.

entries.name: Seek YHWH and live (anti‑pilgrimage)
entries.blurb: Do not seek Bethel/Gilgal/Beersheba; seek the living God whose name is not a site.

entries.name: Booth of David restored
entries.blurb: Fallen shelter raised, breaches repaired—royal hope reframed as sheltering presence.

entries.name: Nations called by my name
entries.blurb: Gentile inclusion as covenant expansion—mission hinted in restoration.

entries.name: Plowman overtakes reaper; mountains drip wine
entries.blurb: Hyper‑abundance images undo the famine and drought—creation healed by justice.

entries.name: Replanted in their land, never again uprooted
entries.blurb: Security as gift of God’s planting, not empire’s protection.

entries.name: Formula: For three transgressions, even for four
entries.blurb: Numerical proverb pattern escalates guilt and attention—rhetoric that hooks the audience before turning inward.

entries.name: Reception: James cites Amos at Jerusalem Council
entries.blurb: Early church reads Amos as promise for Gentile inclusion without circumcision burden.
